intro: Calonyction aculeatum var. lobatum, commonly known as the spiny globe-thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features a compact, spherical shape with spiny, lobed leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. The plant produces showy, pale blue to violet flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
